title: How much would you pay someone for a book's summary? - Quora

response.answer_text: Nothing. That isn’t something I would do. However, I see that the question I was originally asked was how much would I pay for the narration of a book, which is completely different. That would presumably mean turning a printed book into an audiobook. For those, I generally split the proceeds 50/50 with the reader; I’m too cheap to pay anything up front, but Audible’s ACX service is happy to do an even partnership.

Once more, the people or the algorithm at Quora has mistakenly merged questions. The one I am answering here is, How much did you pay for your book’s narration. The subject of paying for a book’s summary is an entirely different subject. I paid nothing for the narration of my books. That is, nil, zip, $0.00. The publisher paid. I was paid for that publisher to license the rights to have my books narrated.
